body: @chaitr91 I will move this issue to the next version, looking forward your next PR.

> > > Hi @linghengqian , I just found it's an already fixed issue of `5.0.0-beta`: [call init method](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/pull/11931), you could try master branch, or just wait several days of `5.0.0-RC1` release.
> > 
> > 
> > Thank you for your answer, but in your deleted reply, you mentioned that "getType()" should not return NULL, but the source code does return null for the use case. Why?
> 
> I'm sorry, I got something wrong at the first glance.

Yes, I saw the question in ShardSphere 5.0.0-beta's source code, thanks again for your answer.

shardingshpere-proxy 4.1.1 @sandynz
thanks
could u provider a demo to reproduce it as i do not reproduce it on master latest code?
do shardingshpere-proxy 4.1.1 can not support password?
Hi @1327681842  , for English only, please modify the issue title and content, thank you.
so what the problem is? or you can check the field null in your encrypt algorithm.

> so what the problem is? or you can check the field null in your encrypt algorithm.

Thanks for your reply, I use the default AES encryption，can you tell me how to not encrypt the null value？
For example, You could copy the default AES encryption then customize it as 'AES1' in your project, then check the field null.

@RaigorJiang Yes, I'm using sharding-proxy (multi tables but single database). And the `CREATE TABLE` SQLs are all executed through sharding. So the charset of the tables are all the same. And I've checked, all utf8mb4 indeed.

> Hi @ulwfcyvi , could you submit issue with template? Much information is needed for us

org.apache.shardingsphere.db.protocol.postgresql.payload.PostgreSQLPacketPayload#writeInt2 value java.lang.NullPointerException: null 

How to fix this

Yes, PostgreSQL authentication is added after version 4.1.1

@colinchouzgl  OK.
Then, please provide your JDBC URL information (pay attention to confidentiality), including the JDBC URL information for the application to connect to the Proxy and the JDBC URL for the Proxy to connect to the physical database.
@Swastyy  Thank you for your hard work!  💯

Sorry, this is a problem with my configuration. Since my project uses both Mybatis Plus and ShardingSphere-JDBC, according to the documentation of Mybatis Plus, I mistakenly thought that the entity class @TableId(type = IdType.NONE) and @TableId( type = IdType.INPUT) is the same function. The problem is solved after the annotation of the primary key of the entity class is changed to @TableId(type = IdType.NONE).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20187731/137496512-3bea44b2-8df6-41e8-bfe7-ea4d6c695e63.png)

Hi @penghuazhou 
Can you try the latest version 5.0.0-beta?  It may be improved.

Hi @JiaXiaohei ,
Can you try the latest version 5.0.0-beta?  I think the time issue has been fixed.

JDBC URL for the Proxy to connect to the physical database:
`jdbc:mysql://{HOST}:3306/{PHYSICAL_DB_NAME}?useSSL=false&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8&serverTimezone=Asia/Shanghai`

JDBC URL for the application to connect to the Proxy:
`jdbc:mysql://{HOST}:3307/{LOGICAL_DB_NAME}?useSSL=false&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8&serverTimezone=Asia/Shanghai`

Please also check whether the JDBC parameters of `each` physical database connected by the Proxy are consistent.

In addition, you can try the following configuration (for each JDBC URL):
useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&serverTimezone=Asia/Shanghai&character_set_server=utf8mb4&connectionCollation=utf8mb4_bin

Thank you for your answer, it is indeed that my configuration file is wrong.
Change
```yaml
spring:
  shardingsphere:
  rules:
    sharding:
      tables:
        tb_result3_sharding_sphere:
          actual-data-nodes: ds0.tb_result3_sharding_sphere_$->{0..366}
```
to
```yaml
spring:
  shardingsphere:
  rules:
    sharding:
      tables:
        tb_result3_sharding_sphere:
          actual-data-nodes: ds0.tb_result3_sharding_sphere_$->{1..366}
```
The main reason is that when I created the table according to the rules of the custom sharding algorithm, tb_result3_sharding_sphere_0 was not created.
The problem has been resolved, I will close this issue.

Hi @penghuazhou 
What Proxy supports is a database protocol, not a programming language or framework.
If Proxy cannot be used normally, we need to analyze what the input SQL statement is, please do not provide information about a specific language or framework. This is not helpful to us.

In addition, compared to version 4.x, 5.0 has more support for SQL statements, which is why I ask you if you can try the new version.
